description: Anwar vowed to change Malaysia when he became prime minister. Now, his critics see him perpetuating revenge politics.
title: Anwar’s Feud With 99-Year-Old Rival Looms Over Malaysia’s Revival

description: France and the US will propose a 21-day cease-fire between Israel and Hezbollah in Lebanon in a bid to open space for negotiations and defuse a crisis that threatens to spark all-out war.
title: France and US to Propose 21-Day Truce for Lebanon, Minister Says

description: Good morning, it’s Georgie here in Sydney with this morning’s top news for you.Today’s must-reads:• Chalmers starts China trip• Monthly inflation eases• Iron ore rallies
title: Treasurer Chalmers Heads to China

description: Vice President Kamala Harris vowed to create a national stockpile of critical minerals, saying a cache of the materials used in everything from batteries to defense systems is needed for economic and national security.
title: Harris Vows to Create US Critical Minerals Stockpile, Incentives

description: President Joe Biden celebrated “a new era of relations” with Vietnam as he met with the country’s Communist Party’s General Secretary To Lam amid US efforts to counter Chinese economic and security influence across Asia.
title: Biden Meets Vietnam’s Top Leader in Veiled Counter-China Play

description: The US Senate voted Wednesday to hold Steward Health Care’s chief executive officer in criminal contempt for failing to testify about his role in the collapse of the bankrupt hospital operator’s finances.
title: US Senate Holds Steward CEO in Criminal Contempt in Rare Vote

description: The US on Wednesday announced a new weapons package for Ukraine worth $375 million, including ammunition for rocket systems and artillery, as well as armored vehicles and anti-tank weapons.
title: Biden OKs Ukraine Weapons Package With Zelenskiy in US

description: Keir Starmer is set to meet with US business executives including Blackstone Inc. President Jon Gray, JPMorgan Asset Management Chief Executive Officer Mary Callahan Erdoes and Bank of America CEO Brian Moynihan on Thursday as the British prime minister seeks to attract investment to boost Britain’s flagging economy.
title: Starmer to Meet US Business Chiefs as He Touts for UK Investment

description: Donald Trump is planning to return to the site of the first assassination attempt on his life, a move that highlights one of the most shocking moments of the 2024 campaign with the potential to motivate supporters to show up to vote.
title: Trump Plans to Return to Site of Shooting in Butler, Pennsylvania

description: Relations between Mexico’s president-elect and Spain are off to a bad start over grievances about abuses against Indigenous peoples committed by Spanish conquistadors centuries ago.
title: Spain Skips Mexican President’s Inauguration Amid Colonial Spat

description: Exxon Mobil Corp. revealed it paid $7.41 billion in taxes and royalties to the United Arab Emirates last year, more than any other country globally, in its first-ever disclosure of payments to host governments.
title: Exxon Paid More Tax to UAE Than Any Other Country in 2023

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, energy and climate reporter Jennifer A. Dlouhy explains why Kamala Harris isn’t talking much about climate change on the campaign trail. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Harris Makes Climate Change a Footnote in Presidential Campaign

description: The US House on Wednesday averted a politically damaging government shutdown and quickly passed a short-term federal funding bill before members darted from Washington for a final campaign stretch ahead of the November election.
title: House Speaker Johnson Turns to Democrats to Avert Government Shutdown

description: Vice President Kamala Harris vowed to be an ally to both corporate executives and the employees who work for them, as the Democratic presidential nominee outlined her vision for an “opportunity economy” that funds new industry investments and builds the middle class.
title: Harris Casts Herself as Pro-Labor ‘Capitalist’ in Economic Pitch

description: Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez, one of the highest-profile lawmakers in the New York congressional delegation, called on New York Mayor Eric Adams to step down, citing the growing cloud of investigations engulfing his administration.
title: AOC Calls for New York Mayor Adams to Resign Amid Probes

description: Prime Minister Justin Trudeau’s main political opponent tried to force a snap election on Wednesday, but the effort failed due to a lack of support from the other opposition parties in Parliament.
title: Trudeau Survives Attempt to Force Snap Election by Poilievre

description: Wealthy neighborhoods in Quito remain under threat of flames and schools have shifted to online teaching through the end of the week as firefighters battle forest fires in Ecuador’s capital.
title: Ecuador Fires Threaten Rich Neighborhoods, Force President Home

description: Australian Treasurer Jim Chalmers will kick off a visit to China on Thursday, the first by the nation’s top economic decision-maker in seven years, as concerns in Canberra grow over the potential impact from a far-reaching slowdown in its top trading partner.
title: Australia’s Treasurer Heads to China as Fears Grow Over Slowdown

description: Chilean lawmakers gave their final approval to legislation that clamps down on tax evasion and boosts government revenues, handing President Gabriel Boric a win days before he unveils the 2025 budget.
title: Chile Congress Backs Legislation Generating Billions in New Tax Revenue

description: Marine Le Pen’s far-right party is increasing the pressure on Emmanuel Macron’s new government with a public push to try to overturn the French president’s unpopular pension reform.
title: France’s Far Right Seeks to Abolish Macron’s Key Pension Law

description: Italy will seek ways to finance the nation’s budget with a direct contribution from banks and companies, but it won’t put a tax on extra corporate profits.
title: Italy Says It Won’t Seek to Impose Tax on Extra Company Profits

description: Republican presidential nominee Donald Trump called on Apple Inc. to aid federal investigators in accessing phones and applications belonging to two men accused of plotting assassination attempts on his life.
title: Trump Calls On Apple to Decrypt Phones of Would-Be Assassins

description: The US is working with allies including France and the UK toward a proposal to halt the escalation between Israeli forces and Hezbollah militants in Lebanon, which has killed hundreds and risks sparking a broader Middle East conflict.
title: US Working With Allies to Halt Israel-Hezbollah War in Lebanon

description: President Vladimir Putin said Russia will revise its nuclear doctrine to include a response to “aggression” by non-nuclear states that is supported by other nuclear powers.
title: Putin Broadens Nuclear Doctrine to Counter Western ‘Aggression’

description: As Keir Starmer worked to reassure Labour members about his “calm, determined” leadership at his party’s annual conference, behind the scenes in Liverpool senior aides and lawmakers were privately sounding the alarm bells and urging him to get a grip after a shaky start to his premiership.
title: Starmer’s Allies Urge Him to Get Control After Early Wobbles

description: President Volodymyr Zelenskiy’s push this week for more support for Ukraine in its fight against Russia’s invasion has hit political turbulence in the US as the presidential campaign heats up.
title: Zelenskiy’s Push for Support Runs Into US Campaign Tensions

description: Ireland will dedicate the nearly €14 billion ($15.6 billion) tax bill it’s receiving from a recent Apple Inc. court ruling for housing, energy and water infrastructure, Irish Prime Minister Simon Harris said.
title: Apple Tax Boon to Go Toward Housing, Energy, Irish Premier Says

description: Libya’s factions reached a “compromise” on appointing new leadership for the OPEC member’s central bank, the United Nations said, an initial step toward eventually resolving a crisis that’s slashed oil output.
title: Libyan Rivals Reach Compromise on Appointing Central Bank Leader

description: Bad Bunny has made Puerto Rico’s Latin trap music genre a global phenomenon worth millions of dollars. He’s now using that stardom to try to upend politics on his home island.
title: Bad Bunny Pays for Billboards in Push to Upend Puerto Rico Vote

description: Rising tensions between the US and China are starting to upend global trade flows, posing both an opportunity and a risk for the developing world, according to Nobel Laureate Joseph Stiglitz.
title: Stiglitz Says US-China Tensions Are Upending Global Trade Flows

description: The European Commission is not involved in any talks to facilitate a continuation of the transit of natural gas via Ukraine’s pipeline system to the bloc, according to Ditte Jorgensen, director general for energy.
title: EU Official Says Bloc Is Not In Talks on Gas Transit Via Ukraine

description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy took sharper aim at China’s efforts to influence the war with Russia, accusing Beijing of pushing a flawed peace plan while simultaneously helping Moscow target nuclear infrastructure.
title: Zelenskiy Says China Pushing Peace While Aiding Putin’s Attacks

description: A US arbitration panel has come out in favor of United States Steel Corp. in a dispute with union workers over Nippon Steel Corp.’s plan to buy the Pittsburgh-based company, according to the United Steelworkers.
title: US Steel Gets Favorable Outcome in Union Arbitration Over Deal

description: Sri Lanka’s new president Anura Kumara Dissanayake said he plans to start discussions with the International Monetary Fund as part of his focus on establishing stability in the island nation before rolling out other initiatives.
title: Sri Lanka President Plans to Start IMF Talks, Focus on Stability

description: The US wants to turn the cash-strapped police mission it pitched last year to tackle Haiti’s security crisis into a United Nations peace operation, hoping a formal arrangement will allow more funds to flow into the Caribbean nation.
title: US Changes Tack on Haiti, Pitching UN Mission Amid Scant Funding

description: Since Hamas launched a new war with Israel on Oct. 7, the Lebanese militia Hezbollah has expressed solidarity with the Islamist Palestinian group through military action. It has fired missiles, mortars, rockets and explosive drones into northern Israel almost daily, prompting Israel to respond with its own fire. The fighting escalated in late September.
title: Why Hezbollah Is More Worrying to Israel Than Hamas

description: Floods that have submerged parts of Nigeria at the onset of the harvest season have destroyed crops that would have fed 8.5 million people for six months, the United Nations’ Food and Agriculture Organization estimated.
title: Floods Destroy Food for 8.5 Million Nigerians, UN Estimates

description: UniCredit SpA spoke with German officials about building a stake in Commerzbank AG before Berlin began selling its shares in the firm earlier this month, adding to the confusion around Germany’s position that it was unaware the move would be coming.
title: UniCredit Flagged Commerzbank Interest to Germany Ahead of Move

description: France’s new government warned that the budget deficit has widened much more than expected and pledged to take tough action to ensure credibility as rattled investors resumed selling the country’s bonds.
title: French Government Pledges Tough Measures as Deficit Balloons

description: Texas Democrats have been trying and failing to win statewide office for three decades. US Representative Colin Allred, a former National Football League linebacker, is out to prove that this time is different.
title: Ex-NFL Linebacker’s Long-Shot Bid Against Ted Cruz Emerges as Senate Nailbiter in Texas

description: Russian lawmakers approved a bill aimed at widening the net for recruiting more people to the army in response to a deepening shortage of soldiers for President Vladimir Putin’s war on Ukraine.
title: Russia Poised to Enlist Criminal Suspects to Fight in Ukraine

description: Canada’s rapid population growth is edging down as Prime Minister Justin Trudeau’s government cuts back on immigration. Yet the country is still a long way from its goal of drastically reducing temporary residents — a group that’s now larger than ever.
title: Trudeau’s Immigration Plan in Doubt as Population Gains Ebb Slowly

description: Georgia’s parliamentary speaker said the US had withdrawn an invitation for the premier to attend a reception hosted by President Joe Biden, branding the move as interference in the Black Sea nation’s internal affairs.
title: Georgia Lawmaker Decries Snub of Premier for Biden Reception

description: Even as global powers meet in New York on Wednesday to discuss how to end Sudan’s brutal civil war — and get the foreign countries fueling it on board — the ongoing assault on a major city in the famine-stricken Darfur region makes the likelihood of peace even more remote.
title: War Engulfs Besieged City in Sudan as Global Powers Meet at UN

description: An emerging plan to loosen the UK’s rigid fiscal rules could help Prime Minister Keir Starmer resurrect his ambitious climate investment plans and answer critics who say his government lacks a plan to generate growth.
title: Labour Set to Change Debt Rules to Unlock Billions in Borrowing

description: A war that ends with three brutalizing Israeli occupations — in Gaza, the West Bank and southern Lebanon — would offer the antithesis of long-term security to the world’s only Jewish state.
title: In Lebanon, Israel Set a Trap for Iran and Itself

description: United Nations-led talks on Libya’s central bank crisis resumed, as a damaging oil blockade that’s slashed the OPEC member’s output nears a second month.
title: Libya Crisis Talks Resume as Oil Blockade Nears Second Month

description: The German government reiterated its opposition to any takeover of Commerzbank AG while indicating its powers to intervene are limited.
title: Germany Opposes Commerzbank Takeover But Concedes Hands Are Tied

description: Israel stepped up its heaviest air attacks on Hezbollah targets in Lebanon since 2006 after shooting down the first missile ever fired at Tel Aviv by the militant group.
title: Israel Widens Air Strikes After Hezbollah Fires at Tel Aviv

description: China launched an intercontinental ballistic missile into the Pacific Ocean in what appeared to be its first such public test in some four decades, a move likely to rattle the US as it seeks to sway world leaders at a meeting of the United Nations General Assembly.
title: China Holds Rare ICBM Test Into Pacific to Show Might

description: Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump was briefed by Biden administration officials Tuesday on “real and specific threats from Iran to assassinate him,” his campaign said in a statement.
title: Trump Briefed on Iran Assassination Plot, Campaign Says

description: Washington gubernatorial candidate Bob Ferguson defended the state’s capital gains tax, emphasizing its vital role in funding education, as a Republican-backed ballot initiative seeks to repeal it.
title: Washington Governor Frontrunner Defends Capital Gains Tax
